sentences.literal: Fan Kuai, Marquis of Wuyang, was a man from Pei.

sentences.chinese: 以屠狗為事，與高祖俱隱。
sentences.literal: He made his living butchering dogs, and hid himself together with Gaozu.
He initially followed Gaozu in rising at Feng, attacking and taking Pei.

sentences.chinese: 高祖為沛公，以噲為舍人。
sentences.literal: When Gaozu became Duke of Pei, he made Kuai his attendant.

sentences.chinese: 從攻胡陵、方與，還守豐，擊泗水監豐下，破之。
sentences.literal: He followed in attacking Huling and Fangyu, returned to defend Feng, attacked the Si Shui supervisor below Feng, and broke him.

sentences.chinese: 復東定沛，破泗水守薛西。
sentences.literal: He again went east to pacify Pei, breaking the Si Shui defender west of Xue.

sentences.chinese: 與司馬夷戰碭東，卻敵，斬首十五級，賜爵國大夫。
sentences.literal: He battled with Military Secretary Yi east of Dang, repelled the enemy, beheaded fifteen heads, and was granted the nobility rank of State Grand Master.

sentences.chinese: 常從，沛公擊章邯軍濮陽，攻城先登，斬首二十三級，賜爵列大夫。
sentences.literal: He often followed, as Duke of Pei attacked Zhang Han's army at Puyang, attacked the city and was first to ascend, beheaded twenty-three heads, and was granted the nobility rank of Ranked Grand Master.
He again often followed, following in attacking Chengyang, being first to ascend.

sentences.chinese: 下戶牖，破李由軍，斬首十六級，賜上閒爵。
sentences.literal: He took Huyou, broke Li You's army, beheaded sixteen heads, and was granted upper leisure nobility.

sentences.chinese: 從攻圍東郡守尉於成武，卻敵，斬首十四級，捕虜十一人，賜爵五大夫。
sentences.literal: He followed in attacking and besieging the Dongjun guard captain at Chengwu, repelled the enemy, beheaded fourteen heads, captured eleven captives, and was granted the nobility rank of Five Grand Masters.
He followed in striking the Qin army, exiting south of Hao.
He broke the Hejian guard's army at Gangli.

sentences.chinese: 擊破趙賁軍開封北，以卻敵先登，斬候一人，首六十八級，捕虜二十七人，賜爵卿。
sentences.literal: He struck and broke Zhao Ben's army north of Kaifeng. Because he repelled the enemy and was first to ascend, he beheaded one scout, sixty-eight heads, captured twenty-seven captives, and was granted the nobility rank of Minister.
He followed in attacking and breaking Yang Xiong's army at Quyu.
